page.title: 09RHYMNEY ARCHITECTURE
page.content: St.David's Church,Rhymni, is one of the most interesting churches in the Valleys of South Wales.Although it is probably one of the last Neo-Classical churches to be built in Wales, its appearance is indicative of the strong Nonconformist influence of the time. A large plain church with little ornamentation its only extravagence is a dentilled pediment.It was designed by Philip Hardwicke in 1839 and the cost of the building works was borne by the Rhymney Iron Company.The church was consecrated in 1843. To single out an individual chapel from the many built in the heyday of Non-Conformity is a daunting task. However,if only from an architectural viewpoint, Beulah Chapel 1866 may be considered, with its interesting nameplate and round window containing star tracery.
